intro: Elatostema goudotianum var. bemarivense, commonly known as the Bemarivana false shamrock, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with three heart-shaped lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
